definitions.definition: To repeat (the exact words of a person).
examples: The writer quoted the president's speech.

definitions.definition: To prepare a summary of work to be done and set a price ; to estimate .
examples: Can you believe they quoted me $5,000?

definitions.definition: To name the current price, notably of a financial security.
To indicate verbally or by equivalent means the start of a quotation .
To observe, to take account of.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To repeat (the exact words of a person).
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To prepare a summary of work to be done and set a price ; to estimate .
( commerce , transitive ) To name the current price, notably of a financial security.
( intransitive ) To indicate verbally or by equivalent means the start of a quotation .
( archaic ) To observe, to take account of.
